page.title: 17Tourism
page.content: In Torquay there are many small hotels and guest houses. There are also some whoppers like The Imperial and The Palace. The small places only have 'Bed and Breakfast'. Prices range from Â£5-8 per night. Many people earn extra money through this way or by working on the beach and so on. In summer the population nearly doubles with Grockles (holiday makers) and foreign students. Torquay has a lot to offer the average tourist: hot weather, night clubs, parks, a marina, ice creams and sand. Those who live here don't have quite such a view of it because it's so crowded in summer!!! Five minutes from the beach is the old village of Cockington with lots of thatched cottages. People (in summer) pay Â£'s just to go there in a horse and cart. Still, if not for the tourists Torquay wouldn't be here.
